title: Privacy Policy for Fire Detection and Suppression System

content.heading: 1.1 System Data
items: Sensor readings (smoke, temperature, flame, and camera data).
Logs of fire detection, verification, and suppression events.

content.heading: 1.2 Personal Data
items: Name, contact details (email, phone number), and location of users.
Preferences and configurations set in the Lab Management System (LMS).

content.heading: 1.3 Device Data
items: IP addresses and system usage logs.

sections.title: 2. How We Use Your Information
content: Monitor and manage the fire detection and suppression system.
Use sensor and event data for training AI models and improving detection accuracy.
Notify users of system events, updates, and maintenance requirements.
Store logs and reports for fire incident documentation and regulatory compliance.

content.heading: 3.1 With Third Parties
items: Emergency Services: In case of a fire event, system logs and location data may be shared with local fire departments.
Service Providers: To process payments, store data securely, or send notifications.

content.heading: 3.2 Within the Company
items: Data collected from your system may be stored in the centralized LMS for internal research and AI model training.

content.heading: 3.3 Legal Obligations
items: We may disclose data to comply with legal requests or enforceable governmental requirements.

content.heading: 4.1 Storage Locations
items: Data is stored in two copies: Local LMS for immediate processing and Cloud LMS for backup and AI development.

content.heading: 4.2 Security Measures
items: Data is encrypted both at rest and in transit.
Role-based access ensures only authorized personnel can access sensitive data.
Regular audits and updates ensure the system remains secure against emerging threats.

content.heading: 5.1 Access and Control
items: Users have the right to view system logs and data collected by their network.
Users can modify notification preferences and system settings.

content.heading: 5.2 Data Deletion
items: Users may request the deletion of their personal data, subject to legal and operational requirements.

content.heading: 5.3 Data Sharing Preferences
items: Users can opt out of non-essential data sharing, such as anonymized data used for AI model improvements.

sections.title: 6. Cookies and Tracking
content: For systems with dashboards or web applications:
Cookies are used to maintain session data and improve usability.
Users can manage cookie preferences through their browser settings.

sections.title: 7. Childrenâ€™s Privacy
content: Our services are not intended for individuals under the age of 13. We do not knowingly collect data from children.

sections.title: 8. Updates to This Policy
content: We may update this Privacy Policy periodically to reflect changes in technology, regulations, or company practices. Any changes will be communicated through the LMS dashboard or email notifications.
